definition: to feel oppressed/to be depressed/to feel dejected
to choke/to stifle/to restrain/to hold back/to hold in (urine)/to hold (one's breath)

sentences.english: He complained of having a chest.
Taking this product without adequate fluid may cause choking.
sentences.chinese: 服用期间不喝足够的水会导致憋闷。

sentences.english: After the people no longer feel oppressed, it will naturally feel better.
sentences.chinese: 过后，人不再憋闷，心情自然就会好起来。

sentences.english: I am -ling in this close room .
sentences.chinese: 在这个窄狭的房间里面我感到憋闷。

sentences.english: A:I feel suffocated. Would you be kind enough to stop smoking?
sentences.chinese: 我感到憋闷，请您别再吸烟了好吗？

sentences.english: I am going for a walk for the room is too oppressive.
sentences.chinese: “我要出去散步，房间里太憋闷了”英文怎么说？

sentences.english: I feel suffocated. Would you be kind enough to stop smoking?
sentences.chinese: 我感到憋闷，请您别再吸烟了好吗？

sentences.english: Would you be kind enough to stop smoking?
sentences.chinese: 我感到憋闷，请您别再吸烟了好吗？

sentences.english: I am stifling in this close room.
sentences.chinese: 在这个窄狭的房间里面我感到憋闷。

definition: to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
pent-up frustrations/sth that has accumulated in one's mind for a long time
to feel suffocated or oppressed/to choke with resentment/to feel injured or resentful
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
to choke/to stifle/to restrain/to hold back/to hold in (urine)/to hold (one's breath)
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
